result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher G Morris

defendant.name: Morris, Christopher G
defendant.address: 1215 Prairie Creek Blvd Apt 204, Oconomowoc, WI 53066

records.addlTxt:
10:42 AM Defendant Christopher G Morris in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.  Court confirms with the defendant that he does not wish to have a lawyer. Court provides defendant with petition for court appointed attorney and defendant will need to file that if he would like an attorney. State recites the offer and the defendant is provided with a paper copy of the offer.. Court will adjourn for further proceedings in 30-45 days.
Hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant is not to have any violent contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

10:07 AM Defendant Christopher G Morris in court.  Prosecuting attorney Lindsey Hirt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key. Signed by Judge Paul Reilly on 9/15/22.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
